alert.note: Alert for McKinley; San Juan; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 12:41PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central, northwest, and west central New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Sandoval. In northwest New Mexico, San Juan. In west central New Mexico, McKinley. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving northeast across the area around Pueblo Pintado. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Reservation Road 9 between Whitehorse, Pueblo Pintado, and Star Lake, County Road 7900, and Reservation Roads 14, 46, 93, and 7004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
